item.title: Ghost of Yotei is Beating Tsushima in Sales, Sony Reveals
item.content:encoded:
Sony’s CFO has revealed that Ghost of Yotei’s sales have performed better than those of Tsushima in the same period.

One of the biggest releases for Sony PlayStation this year was Ghost of Yotei, the highly anticipated sequel to Sucker Punch’s 2020 hit, Ghost of Tsushima. Sony had confirmed that the title sold 3.3 million copies in the first month, and the budget was very similar to the previous title. Now we know that the latest instalment is also performing better.

Ghost of Yotei Sold Better than Tsushima in the Same Period

Sony CFO Lin Tao’s comments on Ghost of Yotei sales were revealed through an X post (formerly Twitter) by Genki_JPN. Tao stated that Yotei was a “tentpole title” released in 2025 and “exceeded the sales of the previous title in the same period of time.” Sucker Punch’s latest instalment also contributed “significantly” to the financial results of the latest quarter.

Ghost of Yotei was released on October 2, 2025, for the PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 5 Pro. We have yet to receive an announcement for a PC version, which could help boost the sales event further. Yotei has been out for a little over 4 months, and its performance during this period has been better than Tsushima’s. No sales figures were revealed.

What else could help boost the sales is a DLC for the title, and the developers have already mentioned a potential expansion. It just depends on whether they feel players really want to know more about a particular relationship or story element in the game.

In other news, Sucker Punch could work on a new Sly Cooper or Infamous game next. Additionally, here are 7 games like Yotei you can play after finishing it. What are your thoughts on Ghost of Yotei beating Tsushima in sales in the same period? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the PlayStation 5 outselling Nintendo Switch 2 in the 2025 holiday season. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: When Will Fortnite Servers Be Back Up? Fortnite February 5 Downtime, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite players around the world have been locked out of the game on February 5 as Epic Games deploys the latest update to the title, with players impatiently waiting for the Fortnite servers to be back up.

After a huge South Park collab in January, the Battle Royale behemoth is entering a new month with a fresh drop of content, keeping the game alive until the next major seasonal change early in March.

For all the details on the Fortnite downtime and everything coming in the February 5 update, Insider Gaming has you covered.

When Will Fortnite Servers Be Back Up?

Fortnite Servers are down for several hours for the update on February 5, and there is no confirmed time of their return. However, previous updates indicate how long players need to wait.

Server downtime in mid-season updates typically lasts for three to four hours, which means that the Fortnite servers should be back up after the v39.40 update somewhere between 2 AM PT and 2 AM ET.

However, downtime can be longer if issues are discovered or if there is a larger patch to deploy, and social media is the best place to keep track of the server status.

What’s In The Fortnite February 5 Update?

The biggest addition in the February 5 update in Fortnite is the start of a new Fortnite Festival season, with Chappell Roan as the headline act.

After plenty of leaks and rumors, her inclusion as the star of Fortnite Festival Season 13 was revealed by Epic Games, and the new season, of course, means a new Festival Pass to progress through.

In the Battle Royale scene, the South Park collab has now completed, with the Born in Chaos Mini Pass expiring. Unfortunately, if you didn’t complete the pass, those free rewards are now unavailable, though they could return to the Item Shop for purchase in the future.

The Valentine’s Day event is also set to be added, though the dates for its duration are not yet confirmed, and there’s a slew of big collabs coming to the Item Shop, including the second wave of KPop Demon Hunters and two character skins from Marvel Rivals; Magik and Luna Snow.

What are you most excited about in the latest Fortnite update? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out the tease of the Honkai Star Rail collaboration, and read what Fortnite’s design director had to say about plans to ‘spice up’ the current season.

item.title: PS5 Sold More Than Nintendo Switch 2 Last Quarter
item.content:encoded:
The Sony PlayStation 5 can officially claim victory over the Nintendo Switch 2 during the 2025 holiday season.

Sony recently released its Q3 FY2025 earnings. The data show that 8 million PlayStation 5 units were sold in the quarter ending September 30, 2025. In the same quarter, Nintendo sold 7.01 million Switch 2 units. Of note, this was the first full quarter with the Nintendo Switch successor on the market.

The Sony PS5 has been on the market since 2020 and has sold over 90 million units to date. The Nintendo Switch 2 was released in June 2025 and had sold 17.37 million units as of New Year’s Eve 2025.

The Battle Between Sony and Nintendo Rages on

Although Sony had a stronger quarter, the Switch 2 outsold the PS5 in the United States in 2025. Nintendo’s original Switch is currently the second-best-selling console of all time, with 155.37 million units sold. However, Sony’s PS2 remains the best-selling console a quarter of a century after its release, with 160 million units sold worldwide.

Sony’s PlayStation 6 may not be released until 2027, giving Nintendo a head start in this generation. Learn more about the potential release of a PS6 here. Even Xbox, which acts more as a publisher in today’s console market, may not have its next hardware release until 2027.

How do you feel about the current console battle between Nintendo and Sony? Do you think any console will ever outsell the PlayStation 2? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: PlayStation 5 Passes 90 Million Units Sold
item.content:encoded:
Sony has reached another milestone in PlayStation 5 sales.

According to its latest financial report, Sony sold 8 million PlayStation 5 consoles in the third quarter of the fiscal year 2025. As of September 30, Sony was boasting more than 84.1 million sales. This means that, based on the new data, more than 90 million PS5 consoles have been sold.

Despite this milestone, PS5 sales remain down 1.5 million year over year, with 9.5 million consoles sold in the third quarter of the fiscal year 2024.

New data also reveal that combined PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 software sales totaled 97.2 million units. According to Sony, this total covers all PS4 and PS5 titles, including those bundled with PlayStation consoles and PlayStation VR.

Additionally, there are 132 million active users on the PlayStation Network as of the end of the third quarter of the fiscal year 2025. This number is slightly up from 129 million in the same quarter of the previous year.

While Sony had a strong 2025, Nintendo still led the United States in hardware sales for the year with its Nintendo Switch 2 console. Learn more about that here. For updates on when we might see the PlayStation 6, click here.

How do you feel about the success of the PlayStation 5 console? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
